meanings.definition: To measure or determine the dimensions, capacity, or amount of something.
meanings.sent1: She gauged the length of the table using a ruler.
meanings.sent2: The tailor gauged the amount of fabric needed for the dress.
meanings.sent3: He gauged the size of the fish tank before buying a new fish.
meanings.sent4: The teacher gauged the students' understanding of the lesson.
meanings.sent5: The scientist carefully gauged the temperature of the liquid.

meanings.sent1: I gauged the distance to be around five miles.
meanings.sent2: She gauged his reaction to be positive.
meanings.sent3: He gauged the time it would take to finish the project.
meanings.sent4: The coach gauged the team's performance accurately.
meanings.sent5: The weather forecaster gauged the likelihood of rain.

meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a particular standard or specification.
meanings.sent1: He gauged the recipe to suit his taste.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic gauged the engine to run more efficiently.
meanings.sent3: She gauged her speech to be more formal for the occasion.
meanings.sent4: The artist gauged the colors to create a harmonious painting.
meanings.sent5: The tailor gauged the dress to fit perfectly.
